document_data.name: Palace of the Enlightened Throne
document_data.aliases: Palace of the Grand Caliph, Seat of the Great Lion
document_data.mainbody: The '''Palace of the Enlightened Throne''', also known as the '''Palace of the Grand Caliph''' and the '''Seat of the Great Lion''', was the seat of the [[Grand Caliph]] of all of [[Zakhara]].
document_data.Description: The Palace appeared as a small city when viewed from the court, covering several acres of land. All of the rooftops were covered with [[gold]]. The Palace was joined by [[Public Gardens of Huzuz|rich gardens]] that were accessible by the general public.
document_data.Location: Found in the capital city of [[Huzuz]], it was the center of power for a whole continent.<ref>
document_data.History:
Five centuries of building activity led to this splendid, expansive and varied complex. As of [[1367 DR]]{{AQ-time}}, no more changes had been made by [[Khalil al-Assad al-Zahir]] and his two predecessors.

The citizens of Huzuz took great pride in the Palace and it was beloved by all. It was often referred to as "our palace" by the [[Al-Hadhar|al-hadhar]].
